coordinates_origin.documentation:
Defines the origin of the coordinate system, given in RA-Dec.
    That origin is then assumed to lie at the center of a data pixel.

lensing_entities.documentation:
The list of components that define the lensing system.
    In COOLEST, a "lensing entity" means either a galaxy, or an external shear component.

py/seq.documentation:
External shear defined with a strength and orientation.
    
    This profile is described by the following parameters:

    - 'gamma_ext': strength of the shear field
    - 'phi_ext': orientation of the shear field

q.documentation: Axis ratio, semi-minor axis / semi-major axis

py/seq.documentation: A pixelated profile defined on a regular Cartesian grid

q.documentation: Axis ratio, semi-minor axis / semi-major axis
Axis ratio, semi-minor axis / semi-major axis
Axis ratio, semi-minor axis / semi-major axis

n_max.documentation: Maximum order of the Shapelet decomposition

amps.documentation: Set of amplitude values for each shapelet function

ra_list.documentation: RA positions of the lensed point sources

dec_list.documentation: DEC positions of the lensed point sources

amps.documentation: Set of amplitude values for the lensed point sources

py/seq.documentation: A pixelated profile defined on a regular Cartesian grid

noise.documentation: Noise characterized by a noise map, which contains diagonal elements of the data covariance matrix

observation.documentation:
Defines the observation itself, that is the image pixels, the exposure time,
    the noise model and/or properties, the magnitude zero-point and sky brightness.

instrument.name: some instrument
instrument.documentation:
Defines the instrument used for the observation.
    This includes the name of the telescope and detector, the filter, 
    the pixel size, the readout noise and the point spread function (PSF).

cosmology.documentation:
Defines the cosmological model. 
    Currently, only FlatLambdaCDM from astropy is supported, based on H0 and Omega_m.
